message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this amazing product with you. I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a valuable asset. I'm willing to start with a price of $18000. What do you think?
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $14000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to me.
I understand your perspective, Bob, but I still think the product is worth more than $14000 to me. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $16000. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit higher on the price. I'd be willing to pay $13500 for the product. Can we meet at this price?

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go that low. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm counteroffering at $17000. This is as low as I can go.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I still think $13000 is a fair price for the product. Can we meet at this price?

Bob, I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'm counteroffering at $16500. This is as low as I'm willing to go.
I understand that you're trying to get closer to your minimum price, but I'm still a bit higher on the price. I'd be willing to pay $12800 for the product. Can we meet at this price?
